questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.


Exhibit A -

//IMG//



Exhibit B -

//IMG//


Exhibit A shows the SD-WAN rule status and the learned BGP routes with community 65000:10. Exhibit B shows the SD-WAN rule configuration, the BGP neighbor configuration, and the route map configuration.

The administrator wants to steer corporate traffic using route tags in the SD- WAN rule ID 1. However, the administrator observes that the corporate traffic does not match the SD-WAN rule ID 1.

Based on the exhibits, which configuration change is required to fix the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
initial configuration, set-route-tag 1. The rule is to matche tag 10.

choices.C: In the dc1-lan-rm route map configuration, unset match-community.
choices.A: In the dc1-lan-rm route map configuration, set set-route-tag to 10.
choices.B: In SD-WAN rule ID 1, change the destination to use ISDB entries.
choices.D: In the BGP neighbor configuration, apply the route map dc1-lan-rm in the outbound direction.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

The administrator used the SD-WAN overlay template to prepare an IPsec tunnels configuration for a hub-and-spoke SD-WAN topology. The exhibit shows the FortiManager installation preview for one FortiGate device.

Based on the exhibit, which statement best describes the configuration applied to the FortiGate device?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Clearly B is correct: check "auto-discovery-sender" and "dynamic" config

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B

Selected Answer: B
this is clearly a hub based on the "auto-discovery-sender" and "dynamic" commands.
C is wrong because the hub does not automatically discover spokes. Spokes initiate and only then are they discovered by the hub.

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B. Not sure why the key is showing A. Definitely a Hub with ADVPN sender config.
The answer is B. Not sure why the key is showing A. Definitely a Hub with ADVPN sender config.

Definitely hub solely with net device disable along with advpn sender config

Selected Answer: B

choices.D: It is a spoke device that establishes dynamic IPsec tunnels to the hub. The local subnet range is 10.10.128.0/23.
choices.A: It is a spoke device that establishes dynamic IPsec tunnels to the hub. It can send ADVPN shortcut requests.
choices.C: It is a hub device and will automatically discover the spoke devices that are part of the SD-WAN topology.
choices.B: It is a hub device. It can send ADVPN shortcut offers.

questions.question_text: What does enabling the exchange-interface-ip setting enable FortiGate devices to exchange?

choices.C: The gateway address of their IPsec interfaces.
choices.D: The IP address of their IPsec interfaces.
choices.A: The tunnel ID of their IPsec interfaces.
choices.B: The name of their IPsec interfaces.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


The exhibit shows the SD-WAN rule status and configuration.

Based on the exhibit, which change in the measured packet loss will make T_INET_1_0 the new preferred member?

comments.content: Therefore, the correct answer is D: When all three members have the same packet loss.

discussion.content:
- If you set `link-cost-threshold` to `0`, then FortiGate performs a strict metric comparison
-> link-cost-threshold(0)

- The member with the best metric becomes the preferred (tiebreaker)
-> priority-members 5 3 4

All members need to have the same packet loss; otherwise, T_INET_1_0 (5 T_INET_1_0) can't get the preferred member through priority (tiebreaker).

Study Guide Page 202
i don't understand the answer it's D. When all three members have the same packet loss??

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, check ccie8122's answer

comments.content:
continue to not understand.
because seems that the answer should be A because win tie breaker... but is signed D.. 
where it√†s written all members have the same packet loss..

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Since the threshold is 0% and T_INET_1_0 (member 5) has the highest priority, as long as the other two links have the same or higher packet loss as T_INET_1_0, T_INET_1_0 wins the tie breaker.

Selected Answer: D
link-cost-threshold 0 = strict metric comparison
priority-member 5 4 3, T_INET_1_O is hightest priority

Selected Answer: D
Guide 7.2

Selected Answer: D
link-cost-threshold 0 = strict metric comparison
priority-member 5 4 3, T_INET_1_O is hightest priority

choices.D: When all three members have the same packet loss.

choices.A: Two spokes, 192.2.0.1 and 10.0.2.101, forward their queries to their hubs.
choices.C: This is a hub that has received a query from a spoke and has forwarded it to another spoke.
choices.B: This is a spoke that has received a query from a remote hub and has forwarded the response to its hub.
choices.D: Two hubs, 10.0.1.101 and 10.0.2.101, are receiving and forwarding queries between each other.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
